</title>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 89 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Price** 250 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Single Action" /><row>Interact</row></row>

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

A vial of this _enigma-sight potion_ seems to contain fragments of kaleidoscopic crystal that reflect mind-bending scenes. However, these “crystals” act like liquid when poured or consumed. Drinking the potion grants you the effects of a [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) spell, except that you use your Perception modifier and your level for the [secret](/Traits.aspx?ID=142) [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) check instead of the normal counteract modifier and spell level. However, if you critically fail the secret counteract check the effect grants, your mind fills in false, nightmarish information. You become [stupefied 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37) for 1d4 rounds and [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=36) as your brain struggles to process what you see.

</column>
